quizzes.title: The house was burgled while the family was _______ in a card game.
I am sorry that I can’t _______ your invitation.
_______ what he says, he wasn’t even there when the crime was committed.
He has impressed his employers considerably and _______ he is soon to be promoted.
He gave his listeners a vivid ______ of his journey through Peru.
Will you be taking my precious experience into _______ when you fix my salary?
The policeman stopped him when he was driving home and _______ him of speeding.
His stomach began to _______ because of the bad food he had eaten.
If you _____ money to mine, we shall have enough.
He was full of _______ for her bravery.
This ticket _____ one person to the show.
The cow had lost its own calf. but the farmer persuaded it to _______ one whose mother had died.
If we _______ the plan you suggest, we are more likely to be successful.
Science has made great _____ during the past 30 years.
He was a much older tennis player but he had the great ______ of experience.
I had quite ______ on my way to work this morning.
He always studies the ______ in the paper as he wants to find a good second-hand car.
On my present salary, I just can’t________ a car which costs over $3,000.
The girl’s father _____ to buy her a car if she passed her examination.
They are twins and look very _______.
As a result of their ______ the three small independent countries felt less afraid of their powerful neighbour.
When he was a student, his father gave him a monthly ______ towards his expenses.
Is anyone _______ to fish in this river?
His _______ had always been to become an architect.
The ______ of ice-cream sold increases sharply in the summer months.
If you are bitten by a poisonous snake.it is necessary to be given an ______ as quickly as possible.
I’ m ________ to get the tickets for the show today, as there are hardly any left.
The child was told to ______ for being rude to his uncle.
He is ______ a very old man but infact he is only fifty.
As a result of the radio _____ for help for the earthquake victims, over a million pounds has been raised.
Let me know if any difficulties _______.
Could you please _______ an appointment for me to see Mr. Smith?
The police _______ her for helping the murderer to escape.
When John _____ in London he went to see the Houses of Parliament.
I read an interesting _______ in a newspaper about farming today.
Students are expected to ______ their classes regularly.
Before you sign anything important, pay careful _____ to all the conditions.
In the central region the dry season is long and severe, and the ______ annual rainfall is only about 70 cm.
The bicycle was moving so fast that its rider could not ______ an accident.
As soon as the children were _____ , their mother got them out of bed and into the bathroom.
This ____ is not big enough to cut down a tree.
In the market, the merchants _______ and joked with their friends and neighbours.
He couldn’t ____ the thought of leaving his home town for ever.
The room was so quiet that she could hear the _____ of her heart.
Through a mixture of greed and intelligence, he has ______ the biggest landowner in the whole district.
The damage done to my house by the fire has now _______.
The children will not be allowed to come with us if they don’t ___ themselves better.
He has adopted three orphans ____his own six children so that, all together, he has nine children to provide for.
The two scientists disagreed and a _______ argument developed.
The weather was ______ the exceptionally poor harvest.
If you are so senseless as to go on long walks in tight fitting shoes, you must expect to get _________.
After lunch I felt ______ enough to ask my boss for rise.
It is a very popular play, and it would be wise ______ seats well in advance.
She began to feel nervous when the train pulled up at the _____ between Austria and Yugoslavia.
When the bill came, he had to _____ money from his brother to pay it.
The toy boat turned over and sank to the _______ of the pool.
The ball ______ two or three times before rolling down the slope.
The bus ran over the cliff because its _______ failed.
The ______ of the bank where he worked was not in the centre of the city.
Large waves were ______ on the seashore.
______ up children properly is mainly their parents’ duty.
Several prisoners _______ from their guards and escaped.
The specialist was under so much stress that he finally ________.
Well-mannered children have usually been properly _____ by their parents.
The audience waited until the curtain had risen and then _____ into applause.
When she heard from the hospital the father had died, she ______ into tears.
If you put too many potatoes in that paper-bag it will ______.
Every day thousands of ______ fly the Atlantic for negotiations with American firms.
As there was a power cut in the hospital, the surgeon had to _____ the operation.
The book ___ two weeks ago.
The country has a system of ______, most of which date from the nineteenth century.
As we wait no longer for the delivery of your order, we have to ______ it.
He’s not ______ of learning German in six months.
Bill doesn’t _____ what people say about him.
Do you mind if I ______ with my work while you are getting tea ready?
He spoke so quickly that I didn’t ______ what he said.
The flat we have rented is very_______ for the underground station.
It isn’t quite ______ that he will be present at the meeting.
If your bicycle ______ comes off, it is almost impossible to put it back on without getting oil on your hands.
If you ever have the ______ to go abroad to work, you should take it.
The fog made it difficult for the driver to see when the traffic lights _____.
How much would you ______ for repairing my watch?
He was _______ with murder.
Lawyers often make higher _____ for their work than they should.
The customs officer didn’t bother to _______ our luggage.
Some of the older villagers prefer to ______ tobacco rather than to smoke it.
The autumn air felt _____ so she went to fetch a coat.
I’m afraid you have no _____ but to come along with us.
Her husband felt it would be silly to ______ the color of the curtains before they had painted the room.
The terrified hunter, ______ in the arms of a huge bear, fought desperately to loosen its grip.
I shall never manage to beat John at tennis; we are clearly not in the same ______.
The teacher _________ the harder parts of the story.
The sky looks lighter. I think the weather is ______.
He wrote his name ______ and carefully at the top of the paper.
These trees cannot be grown in such a cold ________ as ours.
He took a _______ with him to clean the windscreen of his car.
As the fat man sat down, the deck chair ______ under him, with a loud noise of tearing canvas.
He always wore a shirt with an open ________.
The presently accepted theory of light _______ some of the ideas of both earlier theories.
Very few scientists _______ with completely new answers to the world’s problems.
If you have a _____ to make about the food, I am willing to listen.
He said he had every _____ in his secretary; she would do the right thing.
She was afraid that unless the train speeded up she would lose loose her _____ to Scotland.
Tom was a highly ______ teacher who took his duties seriously but he had neither the personality nor ability to achieve much success.
I was not ______ that I had cut myself until I saw the blood all over my hand.
She has lost her handbag with the _____ sum of $1300 in it.
I have always _____ you my best friend.
She opened the packet and emptied the ______ into a saucepan.
The road lay ahead of him, a(n) _____ grey line stretching to the horizon.
In the capitalist countries, the rising _______ of living is as hard on country families as on city families.
There was a _______ of parchment as the solicitor unrolled the will written on it.
They lay almost flat and ______ through the tubelike underground passage.
You should iron out the ______ in that dress.
A narrow road ______ the stream to the other side of the park.
After a tiring ______ by boat, we reached the island.
Her skirt had been so ______ in packing that she had to iron it before going out.
If I take this medicine twice a day, it should ______ my cold.
The new car at the motor-show was a very _______ shape.
The headlights of the approaching car were so ________ that the cyclist had to stop riding.
People who live in a small village are bound to see a good _____ of each other.
When he was questioned about the missing ring, he firmly _____ that he had even seen it.
When the other car hit mine, it made a huge _______ in my rear bumper.
On Sunday the business centre of the city was usually quite _______.
Ann is so _______ to succeed that I am sure nothing will stop her.
The hall seemed _______ lit after the bright sunshine outside.
As one of the four ______ of the company, he often had to attend Board meetings.
The rainbow _______ as the sun came fully out from behind the clouds.
She felt very ______ when her husband forgot her birthday.
High interest rates _______ people in capitalist countries from borrowing money.
Weeks later he had still not found a job and he began to feel ______ .
Some useful ideas were suggested while the social committee was _____ the club’s programme for the coming season.
The cat showed her _____ for the stale fish by turning her back on it.
He often forgets to do what he has been told and is scolded for being ______.
Please sign your name here on the _______ line.
He criticized everything and everybody and even ran _____ his few friends.
When he heard the bad news, he broke ______ completely.
The carriage was ______ by four horses.
I dislike going to the dentist as he uses the ______ on my teeth.
There is something wrong with his vocal chord sand as a result, he had always been_________
When he beat the carpet, the _____ rose in clouds.
When I came through the customs at the airport, I had to pay ____ on a clock I had bought.
You won’t find a greater variety of flowers anywhere else on _____.
We couldn’t cut the string because the ______ of the knife was not sharp enough.
You can do it if you want to, but in my opinion it’s not worth the _____ it involves.
An ambulance must have priority as it usually has to deal with some kind of _______.
The sun ______ the growth of plants.
When can the students _____ for next year’s evening classes?
You must have ______ the examination before Friday, so bring your money to the office as soon as possible.
He knows so much about the stars that I am sure it would be impossible to find his ______.
On summer _____ many English men work in their gardens when they come home from work.
I ______ him to arrive in time for dinner.
I sat near the entrance for a long time _____ him, but he didn’t arrive.
He hoped the appointment would enable him to gain greater ______ in publishing.
The information-office at the station ___ that all trains were running about one hour behind time.
I could tell he was surprised from the ______ on his face.
Because the company was doing more business, it was necessary to _____ the factory.
The garden ______ as far as the river.
The plain occupies the west, south and central parts of the continent, though considerable variations are to be found over so ______ an area.
Because of the strong sun, Mrs. William’s new dining room curtains ____ from dark blue to grey within a year.
Spies may have a number of _____ names and papers.
Why can’t you do this small _____ for me? I’ve helped you often enough in the past.
The ____ charged by the lawyer for his services was unusually high.
A historical novel is a form of which may include many facts.
The gardener ______ a bucket with water so that he could plant the vegetables.
My petrol tank was empty so I pulled into a garage to ______.
When there’s a doubt the examiner’s decision is ______.
If present dissatisfaction over salaries continues, the _____ result will be loss of staff.
You direct me to the nearest garage? One of my tyres is _____ .
The children thought that the cream was deliciously ______ and they finished it all.
A horse drives the ______ from its body with its tail.
High in the sky a _____ of birds was flying southward.
I usually listen to the weather _____, though I have little faith in it.
The children _____ a line, then walked quietly into school.
Since his retirement, Peter Smith, who was ______ a teacher, has written four novels.
With the invention of the train, man could travel overland _____ without the need of horses.
A strong westerly ______ flattened the standing corn though it brought no rain.
After his prolonged dive in search of the ring he emerged from the water _______.
As the storm drew nearer, black clouds were _______ over the sky.
Mr and Mrs Green ____ a party for their daughter’s twenty-first birthday.
The old lady couldn’t ____ because she had rheumatism.
He doesn’t __ his fellow-workers and there are often disagreements between them.
If we can _____ our present difficulties, then everything should be all right.
It is not _____ for you to eat too much.
You should be very _____ to your teachers for their help.
The peasants’ many ______ resulting from ill-treatment by their landlords led finally to rebellion.
They have a _____ future ahead with little comfort, food or hope.
The old man got into the ______ of storing money under the bed.
Most things are now mass-produced rather than ______.
Be careful how you _____ that jug; It will break very easily.
The ______ of the clock showed that it was time for dinner.
We suddenly saw the bus about to leave and had to run ______ to catch it.
There’s no need to be frightened of the dog; he’s quite ______.
This year the farmers were just able to gather the _____ before the fine weather came to an end.
It was a long time before the cut on my hand _____ completely.
Dearer electricity will mean _______ bills for most families.
When you are riding a bicycle you should _____ the handlebars firmly.
You are not allowed to use the ______ after eleven o’clock at night, as it makes too much noise.
Wolves were _______ mournfully in the nearby forest.
The lorry driver was badly ______ when his lorry crashed into a wall.
All the students were excited at the _______ of a weekend sports competition.
You can _______ my surprise when I heard the news.
Many of the earliest _____ into the United States established large plantations.
The judge said that he was ______ by the high standards of performance by the riders.
We paid the shopkeeper _____ cash.
The crowd stared at the giant and the dwarf as if they were _______ monsters.
Tell your brother to come _____ because it’s going rain in a minute or two.
I cut my finger on a rusty tin and it became badly _______.

He has always gone _____ strange hobbies like collecting bottle-tops and inventing secret codes.
The local tourist bureau will send you _____ about hotels in the area.

The use of plastics for shoes _____ of leather has ruined shoe repairing as a business.
Where do you ______ going for your holidays this year?

Be quiet! It’s rude to ______ people when they are speaking.
During the _____ the audience strolled and chatted in the foyer.
She looked every where for her book but ______ had to return home without it.
Sally married _____ the Kennedy family.
The boy’s allergy to dust caused his skin to _______.
I’m sorry I’m late, I was held up in a traffic _______.
He hit the other boxer so hard that he broke his lower ______.

When he makes a _____ by car, he takes his family with him.
I can’t advise you what to do: you must use your own _______.

You couldn’t ______ any secrets even for an hour in that little town.
The police had to _____ the crow ______.
I should like to ______ touch with old friends but I have so little time.
Shut the window and _____ the cold _______.

I cannot undo the _____ in this piece of string.
______ of money prevented us from taking a holiday this year.
It was the longest film I’ve ever seen; it ______ four hours.
It is time to ______ the table for dinner.
After driving for five hours, the driver pulled into ______ for a rest.
The guide is ______ a line of tourists through the narrow passage with the help of his torch.
She tried to ______ out of the window to see the procession more clearly.
She came to England for a year in order to ______ the language.
I’m sorry I’m late, I was held up in a traffic _______.

If the boy had ______ the dog alone it wouldn’t have bitten him.

Young children ______ older ones, so older children should be good examples.
Will you ______ my essay, please, to find out whether made any mistakes?
One of the tigers has got ______ . Warn everyone of the danger!
Because the children keep interrupting her whenever she reads a book, she is always ________ her place.

I bumped my head on the doorpost and now a _____ has come up.

With its expensive furniture and carefully-chosen colour scheme the room looked quite _______.
If you don’t mind, I should like to ______ a suggestion.
He asked an artist to ______ some drawings to illustrate what he had written.
That doctor’s writing is quite indecipherable. I can’t _______ what he’s written.
After a lot of difficulty, he _____ to open the door.
Her shoes ______ her gloves; they look very well together.
The next ______ of the committee will take place on Thursday.
She heated the chocolate until it ______ , then poured it over the cake.
What he described as a ____ detail I thought was the most important part of the plan.

Spanish is the ______ language of most Spaniards.
Children _______ good food if they are to be healthy.

His friend never spoke ill ______ him.

The peoples of the African interior began to ______ gold in exchange for the goods they needed from abroad.
This young tree could not have been damaged by accident : I believe it was done ________.
The deep pool was so brown and weed-covered that it was almost ______.

My employer’s ______ of my work does not matter to me at all.

This blue door was _____ painted green.
He must give us more time, ______ we shall not be able to make a good job of it.
Can you possibly make ______ what he has written here?

I’ve never seen such a big ______ of feet!
Suddenly the crowd _____ and moved back, and the police pushed through.

When there was a short ______ in the conversation, I asked if anyone would like anything to drink.

______ to leave early is rarely granted.

I washed this dress and the colour _____.

A ______ from the local paper asked for details of the accident.

He looked for a table to sit down at, but they were all _____.

This theory ______ from the work of certain early 20th-century in science.

The bank ______ planned to escape in a stolen car.
Walking down the street, she noticed a long _____ of houses all exactly alike.
These figures give a rough guide to the cost of your car _______.

In ______ the room resembles the letter L.
I could see the cat’s eyes _____ in the dark.

Although they are poor and hard, they are _________ to their children’s success.

The _____ of the hill made it a very popular place for skiing.

When I bend down to tie my shoelace, the seat of my trousers ______.

After dinner, the minister made a short ______ to the guests.

The disease _____ widely, all over the country.
Do not _____ the butter too thickly on the bread.
The old lady managed to climb the ______ which was narrow but not at all steep.

When the soldiers were on the march, there was one man who was always out of ______ with the rest.

A blinding _____ of lightning flashed across the sky.
The gloves were really too small, and it was only by _____ them that I managed to get them on.
At the first _____ of twelve everyone stopped for lunch.

It was a ____ for the climbers to reach the top of the mountain.

Call for me at any time that _____ you.

The cyclist was riding so erratically that the driver had to _____ to avoid hitting him.
She cried so much that her face became ______.

You must remember to _____ all your belonging out of this classroom today.
What measures have been ______ to control the crowd at Saturday’s football match?

Mary didn’t ______ children quickly.

As the train pulled out of the station, I started to ______ to the man sitting opposite.

His father had ______ him how to make model aeroplanes.

This morning, drivers were warned of_____ fog in all industrial areas.

Hello, Is that 21035? Please put me ______ to the manager.

His name was on the ______ of my tongue, but I just couldn’t remember it.
The teacher _______ them the answer to the question.

When are you going to begin to ______ that animal?
The dressmaker _____ the half-finished blouse but it was obviously too small.
